content.description: Easier climbing low leads to the crux, which includes pulling the moves over the roof near the upper/middle of the route.
content.location: Start at the base of an ugly (and sometimes sandy) chimney. This is the furthest left route on the wall.

climbs.name: The Laying on of the Hands

content.description: The climbing gets more difficult the higher you go.
content.protection: 8 bolts: There are two bolts protecting the smooth face, followed by 3 more bolts leading up the honeycombed rock to the base of the red band, with 3 more bolts heading up and left on the overhanging rock.
content.location: Begin behind a large cube of rock, about 15' right of Rafter Man.

content.description: This is a shady area with a few stout routes worth doing. It is rarely crowded due to its location. Look for rock that is gray and red.
